item.title: Mastering the Laugh
item.description: Mastering the Laugh # Let’s face it, humor is hard! Toastmasters helps us overcome stage fright, speak to strangers and think on our feet. We’re adept at speaking to inform, persuading our audiences and touching them with inspirational tales of love and loss. But how do we “break a leg” (a good thing in comedy parlance) by tickling our audiences' “funny bones”? Speeches employing humor are better received; audiences are more receptive when they’ve laughed.

item.title: Humor to the Rescue
item.description: A witty response is good for business. For a leader who’s building social and business relationships, humor is a wonderful tool. People want to associate with leaders who have a positive personality and a sense of humor. When you are skilled at using humor, it increases trust and likeability. It builds, and sometimes even rescues, relationships. It clearly strengthens your leadership skills. As a significant fringe benefit, a sense of humor gives you a better-tuned humor radar.
